comments.body: I think this would be a pretty cool revival idea. I also would like to see the ability to leave a book on the lectern for people to read, but without removing the ability to read books wherever you'd like. That way, you'd get a choice.

This is one of the best ideas I have seen on this site so far - voted. My suggestion would be to scrap the text box for lore, it would be too cumbersome; instead, have it to where you place a Written Book into another input slot. The contents of the Written Book would become the lore for that item, which makes sense because, well, it's lore!
The lectern’s current purpose is to allow multiple players to read books and quills.
I agree gives a way bigger and better meaning to go mining for ancient debris!

I dont entirely agree with the original comment about magical creatures but a farming update would be awesome. Pams harvest craft for example was incredibly fun to use on Java edition until it stopped being updated for new versions of the game but Mojang doesnt need to go that hard with farming and food items but there absolutely should be a watering can that can be put in a dispenser to spray water onto crops and they grow quicker, having new plants to grow as well would be great and would give reason to add more food into the game and right now, farming isnt really useful because the best food you can get are carrots to craft into golden carrots but those can be bought from villagers so you dont need to farm them, so lets say you make potatoes to have that as your food source, well you can just set up cow farms and have steak as your main food source which is much much better than baked potatoes are, so back to not needing to actually farm crops other than wheat for breeding but if there were more foods and crops you could have stews and actual meals that that require a few different crops and even raw beef to make and would make farming incredibly useful for more than just wheat to breed cows.
like you can make hamburgers, sushi with fish and meat that would be super nice.

i think this would be a great addition especially now that we have phantoms in the game. when you're out exploring far from your base it just isn't convenient to have to set your spawn so far from home just to get phantoms to stop attacking you. plus they would pair really well with campfires!

How about this? I was told to post this here :)

The Warden's Heart can be obtained from the loot chests or the Warden itself upon death. Combining this with a conduit (which requires a heart of the sea, giving it new life) and perhaps a wither rose will create a living, beating, animated Warden's Heart that will stops hostile mobs spawning and endermen teleporting within a very large radius from where it's placed. It can act in a similar way to a conduit, but more compact. This makes sense as the Warden is the only mob that can spawn in the deep dark (all other hostile mobs are terrified of it?).
This comes from a desire to mob proof cities and large builds that incorporate darker, atmospheric lighting or lack thereof, instead of having to painstakingly light up every crevice, which limits creativity. Light can be a beautiful tool to play with when it isn't a requirement.

I think that when the sculk spreads onto ores, it will change the ore into Sculk Ore. When mined you'll get raw skulk ore and you can smelt it into Sculk Bars. With those you can craft it into sculk armor, tools, blocks, and arrows. The sculk armor will start off weak but by killing enemies and getting their exp. , the armor will get stronger and will slightly change its appearance. After a specific amount of exp. is collected, it will be equal to netherite. The main use for it is in the deep dark. Armor and tools don't create sound and when there is sound, the armor will absorb it depending on how leveled up the armor and tools are. It absorption range also depends on the armor's level. Example: If you're running in the deep dark, you will not produce any sound and the sculk sensor will not create a signal. But if you're armor is not upgraded enough you must be very close to the sound to absorb it, while if you're armor is fully upgraded, the range of which it could absorb the sound is much greater. The arrows also don't create a signal nor do any of the weapons or tools. The armor will make you receive less damage from the warden and the tools will do more damage to it compared to regular weapons (also depending on how leveled up they are). The armor will look like regular netherite but dark green when first made, but over time when you collect exp. small protrusions and horns will appear across the armor. (Thanks for reading)

This is how I've XP farmed for years now. It feels pointless to go back to mob grinding while fishing. You also need to find decent spawners or use a mob farm which also got updating out of simply using without afking at it. I don't know why you would want to take away an exploit that doesn't hurt anyone's gameplay? If you don't want to use it you don't have to. Minecraft isn't a competitive game

100%!!!  The FIRST thing I build in the game is a furnace farm and start smelting for future use.  All other farms slow xp generation.  This makes armor significantly more complicated and expensive to build, the cost of enchanting a book to only get a lousy enchantment way more expensive, and makes mending enchantments almost useless.  I'm very frustrated with the game since this change occurred because suddenly my way of repairing my tools is gone.  If you're going to take this, have xp hit all equipment in inventory that need repair BEFORE giving you xp.  Having to select the item specifically when xp is now harder to come by is annoying at best.  Furthermore often XP won't be absorbed and just sits at my feet.  If you're going to fix a bug that benefits us, fix a bug that hurts us too.

Thank you!

 

~Santa

Since the furnace bug was taken away and enchanting is hard for peaceful players on bedrock (no good ways to get xp quickly), perhaps instead of removing ALL XP when removing items, keep the balance and only release up to 1 level of XP at a time so that XP can be banked more and released as needed for mending or enchanting.  Breaking could still release all XP but silk touch would keep XP in furnace for later extraction. That way, peaceful players can set up a super smelter and would not be getting free XP, but can use the XP as needed for mending or enchanting rather than blowing it all at once.

Storing xp in a furnace was the only way that most of us bedrock players got their xp. While we got many levels that brought us into the endgame of Minecraft and then we could explore the infinite possibilities that the game has to offer for us. Taking away our main xp source will slow down our game a lot, causing most of us to quit and stop playing. Almost everyone who plays bedrock loves getting to endgame as quick as possible so we could mess with our friends or just build anything that comes to mind. This makes the furnace xp farms crucial for our own enjoyment. Bedrock players looked at Java players with envy as they could get thousands of levels and could use their overpowered enderman farms and automatic fish farms. This just doesn’t seem fair and we want the furnace xp back. Most of us will not enjoy the game anymore and most of us wil turn away to other games after this. Mojang please bring this back.

Yes keep this in the game as it makes the game fun to play if you have xp to use ,if xp is tedious and boring to obtain (which it now is ) it makes the game dull and gloomy and once you get past early game it’s becomes boring to play because of the lack of EXP
Keep this, please
If we wont ever be able to build on the nether roof then give us this at least! Nothing exploitive or broken about it.

I like the idea of 2 (or even more) top-tier endgame materials. I think that most important quality to the success of this material is how balanced it is with netherite. The two should be balanced enough that the decision between which one you use is interesting.
How about VOIDSTONE, then you smelt it into VOIDGEMS

Honestly I had almost the exact same idea just pop into my head, but here's my view on it.

 

I think the ore should be a creamy-white, similar to End Stone but with a texture more closely resembling quartz - I thought it would be cool referring to it as Ivory, as that shares a similar colour in real life -, rather than purple. Not only will this provide players with a recognisably End-themed armour, it will also allow players to have more vanity options in the game.

 

Considering Netherite Armour has Knockback Resistance built into it (an attribute shared with the Wither), I think that it would be cool if the End Armour had an attribute shared with the Dragon - advanced healing capabilites. This would switch things up for players who enjoy PvP and for players who struggle with the combat side of vanilla survival minecraft, should they get to this point.

 

I think the Ore should be found similarly to Netherite, but not exactly. You know those small island with an almost circular top? I think occasionally, they should have a few of the ores, and a few loot chests - and the ores would be turned into tools and armour and ingots in the same way Netherite is, but perhaps with Ender Pearls or Chorus Fruit?

I agree with pretty much everything you said. I feel like if they make a new structure it should be something like the end portal, just a bit different. The armor should look purplish and have endermen sparkles coming out of it. Like when endermen teleport, they leave behind little particles. Just a suggestion.

I don't know music very well, my brother is great at writing though, he would want this

A noteblock GUI would be fantastic. Rather than using blocks to specify the instrument, and repetitive clicking to get the note, a GUI would make it so much easier and quicker to create in-game music. Further more, without needing to use blocks to set the instrument, songs could be more compact to fit inside smaller builds and all parts to be within range of hearing.
Perhaps, to set the instrument, you'd still need to "fuel" it with the relevant block (maybe like Beacons but where you get the block back if you destroy the note block)

I would also suggest that various other noteblock features could be implemented as part of this, such as sustained (longer duration) notes and more instruments.

Heck this could be a mini update (like 1.15 Buzzy Bees) all by itself.
This post deserves way more votes than it does now.

I agree, we need 3 or 4 full octaves on all or some instruments and must have a way to lengthen note duration too base on music sample length  (simple can't be lengthen more than music sample length).     Please minecraft team, make it  :)

-Show only 1 octave 7+5(12) keys and make it soo you can cange it like pages in a web app for example. The canculation can be something like notevalue = key(1-12) * octave(0-4). Not sure how duable this is tho. :D
